results.title: Trump voter regret might be setting in – slowly - CNN
results.content: Trump voter regret might be setting in – slowly | CNN Politics *   CNN10 *   About CNN Trump voter regret might be setting in – slowly Early in President Donald Trump’s second term, plenty of ink was spilled on the question of whether his 2024 voters regretted their votes. It’s also down slightly from the 74% of Trump voters who said they were very confident in their vote back in April. results.title: Attleboro Elections Commission investigating whether candidate for mayor, councilor is a city resident - The Sun Chronicle
results.content: Attleboro Elections Commission investigating whether candidate for mayor, councilor is a city resident | Local News | thesunchronicle.com Attleboro Elections Commission investigating whether candidate for mayor, councilor is a city resident  Attleboro Elections Commission investigating whether candidate for mayor, councilor is a city resident ATTLEBORO -- The city's elections office is investigating whether a candidate for both mayor and councilor at-large is actually an Attleboro resident. George Spatcher, chair of the elections commission, said a hearing was held Tuesday after a complaint questioning candidate Timothy Barone's residence was made to the office. A records request form was filed by The Sun Chronicle to the elections office to obtain a copy of the complaint as well as information on Barone's voting history in Attleboro.

results.title: New polling places set for parts of Mansfield and Madison Township - Mansfield News Journal
results.content: Several polling locations in Richland County are set to change for the upcoming Nov. 4 general election and all future elections, according to a community announcement from the Richland County Board of Elections. According to the announcement, voters in these precincts are expected to receive notification by mail with their new polling site details. The deadline to request an absentee ballot is 8:30 p.m. Oct. 28. Absentee ballots must be postmarked by Nov. 3 or dropped off at the Richland County Board of Elections, 1495 W. Early in-person voting is scheduled to begin at the Board of Elections office starting Oct. 7 and will end at 5 p.m. Nov. 2. For more information, visit the Richland County Board of Elections website or call 419-774-5530.

results.title: How Trump Is Plotting To Disrupt The Next Election - HuffPost
results.content: Since taking office, Trump has installed loyalists who follow his orders into key positions at the Department of Justice, issued executive orders centralizing decision-making within the White House, attempted to unilaterally change state and local election laws, demanded unprecedented access to voter data, dismantled election security protections, threatened elections officials and workers, law firms and others who have historically stood up to protect elections and defended, hired or pardoned those involved in previous efforts to subvert elections. On March 25, Trump issued a sweeping executive order aiming to allow the president to directly set state election law, despite the president having almost no constitutional role or legal power in the administration of elections.

results.title: Gov. Greg Abbott’s options to force a redistricting vote are more limited than they appear - Politico
results.content: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott had a message Sunday for the dozens of Democratic legislators who fled the state to derail a mega-partisan gerrymander: “This truancy ends now.” However, if the absentee Democratic lawmakers remained in Texas, Abbott could order state troopers to haul them to the Capitol. State law permits a Texas district court to determine whether a public official has “abandoned” his or her office, declaring it vacant — enabling the governor to set new elections to fill the empty seats. And even if Abbott and Paxton win a clean sweep in removing the Democrats from office, it would then require a time-intensive process of calling special elections to fill the vacancies — and guaranteeing that the winners of those elections also remain in the state as well.
